moves.1. b3 e5 2. Bb2 Nc6 3. e3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bd6: Seems weird, but apparently 4... d6, 5. Ne2, Bd7, 6. 0-0, a6, 7. BxNc6, BxBc6, 8. d4 has been good for white.
moves.5. Na3 a6 6. Be2: It seems better 6. BxNc6, dxB, 7. Nc4.
moves.8... Bb4+ 9. Kf1 d5 10. Rc1 O-O 11. Nf3: Black looks better, even if seemed convenient to get out the lsb. Black makes room for the N to go to b4.
moves.12. h3: 12. Nc2, redeploying the useless knight on a3, seemed better.
moves.12... Nb4 13. Qd2 c5: Not hurrying for the pawn in a2.
moves.14. Bc3 Nc6: Threatening c4, discovering an attack on the Na3.
moves.15. Qb2 d4: Takes advantage of the queen's overload due to Na3.
moves.17... Re8 18. Nc2: White thinks he will win neatly the central pawn. Nc4, Bc5 leaves the knight without squares after b5.
moves.18... Bc5 19. b4 Bb6 20. a4: Just to making some room, but a6 just leads to Ba7, and nothing changes for white.
moves.20... Bf5 21. Na3: White should have tried Nh4 instead, since there are no ways to take d4 - and probably it is better for white not to take it, freeing the dsb's action. The lsb is more active right now.
moves.22... Rxe2: If QxR, Qb3 and the knight is lost - to say the less. So...
moves.24. Kxd3 Qe4+ 25. Kd2 Qxf4+ 26. Kd1 Ne4: Blacks finds something more to sac...
If Rxc4, QxQ, NxQ and Nd2+ forking the rook.
moves.35... Nc3+ 36. Ka1 Qc6: No defence to Qxa4+ and mate, not even RxN (Qxa4+, Kb1, dxR, Qxc, Rb8+...)
